description: This demo is about job runner which receives instruction from job manager and submits Apache Flink job to target Apache Flink cluster
covers: How a job runner registers itself into job manager
How a job runner unregisters itself from job manager
How a job runner receives instruction from job manager and act upon the instruction

step1.description: import Postman environments and collections by raw content into Postman. To get raw content of each collection or environment, run shell commands

step2.description: try the following services under Postman Collection 'jr0: runtime config management (use Environment mp0@8080)'
step2.explanation: In essence, the runtime config is the instruction for any service instance in namespace 'demo' and application 'jr0' to materialize/realize services as instructed.

step3.description: try to start a service instance that works as a job runner specialized in submitting Apache Flink job, which is expected to start successfully
shellCommands: docker container run -it -p 8100:8080 --env WEAVE_PRF=standard --env WEAVE_NS=demo --env WEAVE_APP=jr0 --env WEAVE_ENA=true --env WEAVE_MGR=http://<YOUR_MACHINE_IP>:8080 aftersound/weave:bundle
